instruction: Tell me about the BS Four-Year Degree Plan: Computer Science/Computer Science Option (ABET Accredited) at Missouri State University.
response:
This is a sample four-year plan for the ABET-accredited BS in Computer Science (Computer Science Option).

Key details:
• **Total Hours:** 120 credit hours
• **Components:** Includes Core/Major courses, Required Math/Science/GenEd courses, and a required Minor or Second Major (often satisfied by the Math minor).
• **Graduation Requirement:** Students must successfully complete the Computer Science Major Field Test (MFT).

**Resources:**
View the plan here: https://computerscience.missouristate.edu/Major/BS-Four-Year-Computer-Science.html

**Next Steps:**
This is a sample, so you should always meet with your advisor to plan your actual schedule.

metadata.topic: BS Four-Year Degree Plan: Computer Science/Computer Science Option (ABET Accredited)

instruction: What is the BS Four-Year Degree Plan: Computer Science/Computer Science Option (ABET Accredited) program at MSU?
response:
This is a 120-credit hour, ABET-accredited curriculum for the BS in Computer Science, designed to be completed in four years.

It focuses on foundational and advanced Computer Science concepts and includes:
• Specific General Education courses
• Math and Science requirements
• A mandatory Minor or Second Major (often satisfied by Math courses)

**Resources:**
See the sample schedule: https://computerscience.missouristate.edu/Major/BS-Four-Year-Computer-Science.html

**Next Steps:**
This is only a sample. You must meet with an advisor to confirm your schedule.

metadata.topic: BS Four-Year Degree Plan: Computer Science/Computer Science Option (ABET Accredited)

instruction: What are the requirements for First semester (fall) in the BS Four-Year Degree Plan: Computer Science/Computer Science Option (ABET Accredited)?
response:
The sample plan for the First Semester (Fall) includes 11-13 total hours.

**Courses:**
• **CSC 130:** The World of Computer Science (3 hrs)
• **GEP 101/UHC 110:** GenEd First Year Seminar (2 hrs)
• **ENG 110:** GenEd Written Commun. & Info Literacy (3 hrs)
• **MTH 137 or MTH 138:** GenEd Quantitative Literacy (3-5 hrs)

**Resources:**
View the full four-year plan: https://computerscience.missouristate.edu/Major/BS-Four-Year-Computer-Science.html

**Next Steps:**
Meet with your advisor to confirm which Math course is right for you.

metadata.topic: BS Four-Year Degree Plan: Computer Science/Computer Science Option (ABET Accredited)

instruction: Tell me about First semester (fall) for BS Four-Year Degree Plan: Computer Science/Computer Science Option (ABET Accredited) students.
response:
The sample plan for the First Semester (Fall) includes 11-13 total hours.

**Courses:**
• **CSC 130:** The World of Computer Science (3 hrs)
• **GEP 101/UHC 110:** GenEd First Year Seminar (2 hrs)
• **ENG 110:** GenEd Written Commun. & Info Literacy (3 hrs)

View the full four-year plan: https://computerscience.missouristate.edu/Major/BS-Four-Year-Computer-Science.html

**Next Steps:**
Meet with your advisor to confirm which Math course is right for you.

instruction: What are the requirements for Second semester (spring) in the BS Four-Year Degree Plan: Computer Science/Computer Science Option (ABET Accredited)?
response:
The sample plan for the Second Semester (Spring) includes 16-17 total hours.

**Courses:**
• **CSC 131:** Computational Thinking (3 hrs)
• **MTH 314 or MTH 315:** Discrete Math or Algebraic Structures (3 hrs)
• **COM 115:** GenEd Oral Communication (3 hrs)
• **HST 121 or 122:** GenEd US & MO Constitution (3 hrs)
• **BIO 121 or BMS 110:** GenEd Life Sciences (3-4 hrs)

**Resources:**
View the full four-year plan: https://computerscience.missouristate.edu/Major/BS-Four-Year-Computer-Science.html

• **Elective:** upper division (3 hrs)
• **Elective:** upper division (3 hrs)

metadata.topic: BS Four-Year Degree Plan: Computer Science/Computer Science Option (ABET Accredited)

instruction: What are the graduation requirements for the BS Computer Science/Computer Science Option (ABET Accredited) at Missouri State University?
response:
Graduation requirements for the BS in Computer Science include:

• **Total Hours:** A minimum of 120 total credit hours.
• **Core Courses:** Successful completion of all major and General Education requirements.
• **Minor:** A minor or second major is required.
• **Exit Exam:** Successful completion of the Computer Science Major Field Test (MFT).

**Resources:**
See the full degree plan: https://computerscience.missouristate.edu/Major/BS-Four-Year-Computer-Science.html

**Next Steps:**
Meet with your advisor regularly to ensure you are on track to meet all requirements.

metadata.topic: BS Four-Year Degree Plan: Computer Science/Computer Science Option (ABET Accredited)

instruction: How many total credit hours are required for graduation with the BS in Computer Science?
response:
You need at least **120 total credit hours** to graduate with a BS in Computer Science.

**Additional Requirement:**
• At least 40 of these hours must be at the 300-level or above.

**Resources:**
This requirement is listed on the official department flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
Use the flowchart and your C-APP report to track your total hours and your upper-division hours.

metadata.topic: Total Credit Hour Requirement (Missouri State University)

instruction: Is there a test required to graduate with the Computer Science Option?
response:
Yes, successful completion of the **computer science major field test (MFT)** is required to graduate.

**Requirement:**
• You must achieve at least a score of 50th percentile.

**Resources:**
This is a requirement on the official degree flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
Speak to your advisor about when to schedule the MFT, which is typically done in your final year.

instruction: I have taken CSC 325. What courses does this unlock?
response:
After completing CSC 325 (Algorithms & Adv. Data Structures), you have fulfilled a key prerequisite for **CSC 450 (Software Engineering)**.

**Full Prerequisites for CSC 450:**
• CSC 325
• CSC 335 (Database Systems Concepts)
• CSC 360 (Operating Systems)

**Resources:**
See the course flow on the department flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
Ensure you have also taken CSC 335 and CSC 360 before registering for CSC 450.

metadata.topic: Course Prerequisites for CSC 450 (Missouri State University)

instruction: List all the remaining core CS courses a student needs if they have already taken CSC 130, CSC 131, CSC 232, CSC 244, and CSC 333.
response:
Based on the flowchart, if you have completed CSC 130, 131, 232, 244, and 333, here are your remaining core CS courses:

• **Remaining Core CS:**
  • CSC 325(3) Algorithms & Adv. Data Structures
  • CSC 335(3) Database Systems Concepts
  • CSC 360(3) Operating Systems
  • CSC 365(3) Internet Programming
  • CSC 388(3) Intro to Secure Computing
  • CSC 450(4) Software Engineering
  • CSC 482(2) Seminar in Computer Science
  • CSC 565(3) Computer Networks

**Resources:**
Consult the official flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
This list does not include your remaining Math, Science, GenEd, or Elective courses. You must meet with an advisor to map out your full remaining schedule.

metadata.topic: Remaining Core CS Courses (Missouri State University)

instruction: What math courses are required for the Computer Science Option?
response:
The required math courses for the Computer Science Option are:

• **MTH 261(5):** Calculus I
• **MTH 280(5):** Calculus II
• **MTH 314(3):** Discrete Mathematics
• **MTH 315(3):** Algebraic Structures
• **MTH 345(3) or MTH 540(3):** Statistics or Statistical Theory

**Resources:**
See the full list on the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
Note that MTH 261 is a prerequisite for MTH 280. Plan your schedule accordingly.

instruction: What are the science course requirements for the CS major?
response:
You must complete two science courses for the CS major:

• **Physics:** PHY 203(5) Found. of Physics I OR PHY 123(4) Intro to Physics I
• **Life Science:** BIO 121(4) OR BMS 110(3)

**Resources:**
These are listed on the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
The flowchart notes that these courses may also count toward General Education requirements. Check your C-APP report to confirm.

instruction: How many CSC elective hours are needed?
response:
You must complete **9 hours** chosen from the approved CSC elective list.

**Key Restrictions:**
• No more than three hours can count from CSC 399.
• No more than three hours can count from CSC 596.

**Examples of Electives:**
• CSC 330: Intro to Data Science
• CSC 540: Intro. to Artificial Intelligence
• CSC 567: Mobile Computing Applications

**Resources:**
See the full list of elective options on the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
Talk to your advisor about which electives best match your career goals.

metadata.topic: CSC Elective Hour Requirements (Missouri State University)

instruction: What are the prerequisites for CSC 232(4) Data Structures?
response:
The prerequisite for **CSC 232(4) Data Structures** is **CSC 131(4) Computational Thinking**.

**Resources:**
View the course sequence on the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
You must successfully complete CSC 131 before you can register for CSC 232.

instruction: What is the emphasis of the Computer Science Major at Missouri State?
response:
The Computer Science Major (Computer Science Option) at Missouri State has a **strong mathematics emphasis**.

**Accreditation:**
• The program is accredited by the Computing Accreditation Commission of ABET.

**Resources:**
Learn more on the department website: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
If you are interested in a different minor, you may want to consider the Software Development option instead.

instruction: How can I get more information about the Computer Science department at Missouri State?
response:
You can contact the Computer Science Department for more information.

• **Website:** https://www.cs.missouristate.edu
• **Email:** ComputerScience@missouristate.edu
• **Phone:** (417) 836-4157
• **Address:** 901 S. National, Springfield MO 65897

**Resources:**
This contact info is available on the department flowchart and website.

instruction: What does the 'D' mean in the CSC elective list?
response:
According to the legend on the flowchart, 'D' stands for **Demand**.

**Resources:**
See the full legend in the electives box on the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

instruction: How many credit hours is CSC 450(4) Software Engineering?
response:
CSC 450 Software Engineering is **4 credit hours**.

**Resources:**
This is shown on the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
Note that this course has three prerequisites: CSC 325, CSC 335, and CSC 360.

instruction: What are the prerequisites for MTH 280(5) Calculus II?
response:
The prerequisite for **MTH 280(5) Calculus II** is **MTH 261(5) Calculus I**.

**Resources:**
See the course sequence on the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
You must successfully complete MTH 261 before you can register for MTH 280.

instruction: What are the prerequisites for CSC 360(3) Operating Systems?
response:
The prerequisites for **CSC 360(3) Operating Systems** are:

• **CSC 232(4):** Data Structures
• **CSC 244(3):** Computer Architecture

**Resources:**
See the course flow on the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
Ensure you have completed both courses before registering for CSC 360.

instruction: What are the 100-level CSC courses in the plan?
response:
The 100-level Computer Science courses on the plan are:

• **CSC 130(3):** The World of Computer Science
• **CSC 131(4):** Computational Thinking

**Resources:**
These are the starting courses on the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
CSC 131 is the prerequisite for the main CS sequence, including CSC 232 Data Structures.

instruction: What statistics course is required?
response:
Students are required to take one statistics course. You can choose from:

• **MTH 345(3):** Statistics
• **MTH 540(3):** Statistical Theory

**Resources:**
This requirement is listed on the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
Both of these courses require MTH 280 (Calculus II) as a prerequisite.

instruction: I've finished my 200-level core CS courses (CSC 232, CSC 244). What 300-level core courses can I take next?
response:
After completing CSC 232 and CSC 244, you unlock several 300-level core courses:

• **CSC 335(3):** Database Systems Concepts (also requires MTH 314)
• **CSC 360(3):** Operating Systems
• **CSC 365(3):** Internet Programming
• **CSC 333(2):** Lang. & Machines
• **CSC 388(3):** Intro to Secure Computing

**Resources:**
Consult the CS flowchart to visualize these paths: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
Work with your advisor to see how these courses fit into your schedule. CSC 325 is another 300-level core course, but it requires MTH 315.

instruction: What is the note about CSC 399 and CSC 596 in the electives section?
response:
The note in the electives section states:

'No more than three hours can count from **CSC 399** and no more than 3 hours can count from **CSC 596**.'

**Resources:**
This note is listed in the 'Choose 9 hours' box on the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
This means that while you can take these courses, only 3 hours from each will count toward the 9-hour elective requirement.

instruction: Who accredits the Computer Science program at Missouri State?
response:
The Computer Science program is accredited by the **Computing Accreditation Commission of ABET**.

**Resources:**
This is stated on the bottom of the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
You can find more details about ABET accreditation at www.ABET.org.

instruction: What is the phone number for the Computer Science Department?
response:
The phone number listed for the Computer Science Department is **(417) 836-4157**.

**Resources:**
This contact info is on the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

response:
The title at the top of the flowchart is **'Computer Science Option'**.

**Resources:**
View the flowchart here: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

instruction: What is the website for the CS department?
response:
The website for the Computer Science Department is **https::/www.cs.missouristate.edu**.

**Resources:**
This link is provided on the CS flowchart.

• **CSC 515:** Advanced Internet Programming
• **CSC 521:** Compiler Construction
• **CSC 525:** Computer Graphics

instruction: What course is a prerequisite for CSC 131(4) Computational Thinking?
response:
The prerequisite for **CSC 131(4) Computational Thinking** is **MTH 137 or 138**.

**Details:**
• The flowchart notes this can be taken previously or as a concurrent enrollment.

**Resources:**
See the course flow on the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

instruction: What courses are prerequisites for CSC 565(3) Computer Networks?
response:
The prerequisites for **CSC 565(3) Computer Networks** are:

• **CSC 325:** Algorithms & Adv. Data Structures
• **CSC 335:** Database Systems Concepts
• **CSC 360:** Operating Systems

**Resources:**
This is shown on the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
This course is typically taken in the seventh semester, after completing these 300-level courses.

instruction: What is the alternative to the Software Development option?
response:
The flowchart describes the **Computer Science Option** (this plan) as having a strong mathematics emphasis.

It states, 'Students interested in a different minor should consider the Software Development option.'

**Resources:**
This note is on the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

instruction: What are the final courses to take before graduation?
response:
The flowchart shows two courses as the final steps before the 'GRADUATE' box:

• **CSC 450(4):** Software Engineering
• **CSC 482(2):** Seminar in Computer Science

**Resources:**
View the bottom of the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
CSC 450 and 482 are typically taken in the final year, along with CSC 565 and remaining electives.

instruction: What is the address of the Computer Science Department?
response:
The address for the Computer Science Department is:

Computer Science Department
Missouri State University
901 S. National
Springfield MO 65897

**Resources:**
This contact info is on the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

instruction: Are there any prerequisites for MTH 314 or MTH 315?
response:
The prerequisite for **MTH 314or MTH 315 is **csc 232**.

**Resources:**
View the course sequence on the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
You must successfully complete CSC 232 before you can register for mthe314 or mth315.

instruction: What is the email address for the registrar at Missouri State?
response:
The flowchart suggests e-mailing **registrar@missouristate.edu** for the purpose of declaring your minor (which is often Math for this option).

**Resources:**
This information is at the top of the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
If you need to declare your minor, sending an email to this address is the recommended action.

instruction: List all the courses that a student needs to graduate with a Bachelor's of Computer Science.
response:
To graduate with the BS in Computer Science (Computer Science Option), you must complete the following:

• **Core CS Courses (13):**
  • CSC 130(3), CSC 131(4), CSC 232(4), CSC 244(3), CSC 325(3), CSC 333(2), CSC 335(3), CSC 360(3), CSC 365(3), CSC 388(3), CSC 450(4), CSC 482(2), CSC 565(3)
• **Math Courses (5):**
  • MTH 261(5), MTH 280(5), MTH 314(3) or MTH 315(3) or MTH 345(3) or MTH 540(3)
• **Science Courses (2):**
  • PHY 203(5) or PHY 123(4)
  • BIO 121(4) or BMS 110(3)
• **CS Electives:**
  • 9 hours from the approved list
• **General Education:**
  • All remaining GenEd requirements.

**Resources:**
See the full flowchart for visualization: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
You must also complete 120 total hours and pass the MFT exit exam.

metadata.topic: All Required Courses for BS in Computer Science (Missouri State University)

instruction: I have completed CSC 130, CSC 131, CSC 232, CSC 244, and CSC 335. What are the other courses I need to take to graduate?
response:
If you have completed CSC 130, 131, 232, 244, and 335, you still need the following courses:

• **Remaining Core CS:**
  • CSC 325(3), CSC 333(2), CSC 360(3), CSC 365(3), CSC 388(3), CSC 450(4), CSC 482(2), CSC 565(3)
• **Math Courses:**
  • MTH 261(5), MTH 280(5), MTH 314(3), MTH 315(3), MTH 345(3) or MTH 540(3)
• **Science Courses:**
  • PHY 203(5) or 123(4), and BIO 121(4) or BMS 110(3)
• **CS Electives:**
  • 9 hours
• **Other:**
  • Remaining GenEd, 120 total hours, and pass the MFT.

**Resources:**
Compare your progress with the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
Meet with your advisor immediately to build a plan, as you still have all required Math courses to complete.

instruction: I have finished all my required math courses (MTH 261, 280, 314, 315, and 345). What computer science and science courses are left?
response:
If you have completed all required math courses, you still need to complete your CS and Science requirements.

• **Core CS (All 13):**
  • CSC 130(3), CSC 131(4), CSC 232(4), CSC 244(3), CSC 325(3), CSC 333(2), CSC 335(3), CSC 360(3), CSC 365(3), CSC 388(3), CSC 450(4), CSC 482(2), CSC 565(3)
• **Science Courses (2):**
  • PHY 203(5) or 123(4)
  • BIO 121(4) or BMS 110(3)
• **CS Electives:**
  • 9 hours
• **Other:**
  • Remaining GenEd, 120 total hours, and pass the MFT.

**Resources:**
Check the CS flowchart for the course sequence: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
Meet with your advisor to plan your remaining semesters.

instruction: I've passed CSC 130, CSC 131, and MTH 261. What's next and what's left for my degree?
response:
With CSC 130, 131, and MTH 261 complete, you can now take **CSC 232(4) Data Structures** and **MTH 280(5) Calculus II**.

Your remaining required courses for the major are:
• **Core CS:** CSC 232(4), CSC 244(3), CSC 325(3), CSC 333(2), CSC 335(3), CSC 360(3), CSC 365(3), CSC 388(3), CSC 450(4), CSC 482(2), CSC 565(3)
• **Math:** MTH 280(5), MTH 314(3), MTH 315(3), MTH 345(3) or MTH 540(3)
• **Science:** PHY 203(5) or 123(4), and BIO 121(4) or BMS 110(3)
• **CS Electives:** 9 hours
• **Other:** GenEd, 120 total hours, MFT.

**Resources:**
See the flowchart for the full path: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

instruction: I've taken CSC 130, 131, 232, 244, 335, 360, 365, MTH 261, MTH 280, MTH 314, and MTH 315. What core requirements are left?
response:
Based on the courses you've taken, here are your remaining core requirements:

• **Remaining Core CS:**
  • CSC 325(3) (Note: You have MTH 315, a prereq)
  • CSC 333(2)
  • CSC 388(3)
  • CSC 450(4) (Prereqs: CSC 325, 335, 360)
  • CSC 482(2)
  • CSC 565(3) (Prereqs: CSC 325, 335, 360)
• **Remaining Math:**
  • MTH 345(3) or MTH 540(3) (Prereq: MTH 280)
• **Science:**
  • PHY 203(5) or 123(4)
  • BIO 121(4) or BMS 110(3)
• **Electives:**
  • 9 hours of CSC electives
• **Other:**
  • GenEd, 120 total hours, MFT.

**Resources:**
Check your path on the flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

instruction: I have finished all the core Computer Science courses (from CSC 130 to CSC 565). What else do I need to graduate?
response:
If all 13 core CS courses are complete, you must still complete all other degree requirements:

• **Math Courses (5):**
  • MTH 261(5), MTH 280(5), MTH 314(3), MTH 315(3), MTH 345(3) or MTH 540(3)
• **Science Courses (2):**
  • PHY 203(5) or 123(4)
  • BIO 121(4) or BMS 110(3)
• **CS Electives:**
  • 9 hours from the approved list
• **Other Requirements:**
  • Complete all General Education courses
  • Reach 120 total credit hours
  • Pass the MFT exit exam

**Resources:**
See the full list of requirements on the flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

instruction: I just finished CSC 130. What other courses do I need for the CS degree?
response:
After completing CSC 130, you still need to complete the entire main sequence of the major.

• **Core CS:** CSC 131(4), CSC 232(4), CSC 244(3), CSC 325(3), CSC 333(2), CSC 335(3), CSC 360(3), CSC 365(3), CSC 388(3), CSC 450(4), CSC 482(2), CSC 565(3)
• **Math:** All 5 required math courses (MTH 261, 280, 314, 315, 345/540)
• **Science:** Both required science courses (Physics and Bio/BMS)
• **Electives:** 9 hours of CSC electives
• **Other:** GenEd, 120 total hours, MFT exam.

**Resources:**
See the full flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
Your next step is to take CSC 131 and your first math course.

instruction: I am done with CSC 130, 131, and 232. What are the remaining courses for my major?
response:
After completing CSC 130, 131, and 232, your remaining requirements for the major are:

• **Core CS:** CSC 244(3), CSC 325(3), CSC 333(2), CSC 335(3), CSC 360(3), CSC 365(3), CSC 388(3), CSC 450(4), CSC 482(2), CSC 565(3)
• **Math:** All 5 required math courses (MTH 261, 280, 314, 315, 345/540)
• **Science:** Both required science courses (Physics and Bio/BMS)
• **Electives:** 9 hours of CSC electives
• **Other:** GenEd, 120 total hours, MFT exam.

**Resources:**
See the full flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
Your next courses are CSC 244 (which also has CSC 131 as a prereq) and your foundational math courses.

instruction: I've completed all 100/200 level core CS and Math courses (CSC 130, 131, 232, 244, MTH 261, MTH 280). What 300+ level courses are left?
response:
If you have completed the 100/200 level core CS and Math, your remaining 300+ level requirements are:

• **Core CS:**
  • CSC 325(3), CSC 333(2), CSC 335(3), CSC 360(3), CSC 365(3), CSC 388(3), CSC 450(4), CSC 482(2), CSC 565(3)
• **Math:**
  • MTH 314(3), MTH 315(3), MTH 345(3) or MTH 540(3)
• **Science:**
  • PHY 203(5) or 123(4), BIO 121(4) or BMS 110(3)
• **Electives:**
  • 9 hours of CSC electives (most are 300+ level)
• **Other:**
  • GenEd, 120 total hours (ensure 40 are 300+), MFT exam.

**Resources:**
See the flowchart for course dependencies: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

instruction: I am almost done with the core CS classes, only the 400 and 500-level ones are left. What are they, and what else do I need?
response:
The final core CS courses (400/500 level) on the flowchart are:

• **CSC 450(4):** Software Engineering
• **CSC 482(2):** Seminar in Computer Science
• **CSC 565(3):** Computer Networks

In addition to these, you must also complete all other degree requirements:
• **Math:** All 5 required math courses
• **Science:** Both required science courses
• **Electives:** 9 hours of CSC electives
• **Other:** GenEd, 120 total hours, MFT exam.

**Resources:**
See the full flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

metadata.topic: Remaining 400/500 Level Core CS (Missouri State University)

instruction: I have finished all my Math and Science requirements. What computer science courses do I need to graduate?
response:
If you have finished all your Math and Science requirements, you still need to complete the CS-specific parts of the degree:

• **Core CS (All 13):**
  • CSC 130(3), CSC 131(4), CSC 232(4), CSC 244(3), CSC 325(3), CSC 333(2), CSC 335(3), CSC 360(3), CSC 365(3), CSC 388(3), CSC 450(4), CSC 482(2), CSC 565(3)
• **CS Electives:**
  • 9 hours from the approved list
• **Other Requirements:**
  • Complete all remaining General Education courses
  • Reach 120 total credit hours
  • Pass the MFT exit exam

**Resources:**
See the flowchart for the CS course sequence: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

instruction: What are the prerequisites for CSC 450(4) Software Engineering?
response:
The prerequisites for **CSC 450(4) Software Engineering** are:

• **CSC 325(3):** Algorithms & Adv. Data Structures
• **CSC 335(3):** Database Systems Concepts
• **CSC 360(3):** Operating Systems

**Resources:**
This is shown on the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
You must complete all three of these courses before taking CSC 450.

instruction: What courses must I take before CSC 565(3) Computer Networks?
response:
The prerequisites for **CSC 565(3) Computer Networks** are:

• **CSC 325(3)**
• **CSC 335(3)**
• **CSC 360(3)**

**Resources:**
This is shown on the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

instruction: What are the prerequisites for CSC 325(3) Algorithms & Adv. Data Structures?

instruction: What are the prerequisites for CSC 335(3) Database Systems Concepts?

instruction: What course is a prerequisite for CSC 232(4) Data Structures?
response:
The prerequisite for **CSC 232(4) Data Structures** is **CSC 131(4) Computational Thinking**.

**Resources:**
View the course sequence on the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
You must successfully complete CSC 131 before you can register for CSC 232.

instruction: What math class is required for CSC 131(4) Computational Thinking?
response:
The prerequisite for **CSC 131(4) Computational Thinking** is **MTH 137 or 138**.

**Details:**
• The flowchart notes this can be taken previously or as a concurrent enrollment.

**Resources:**
See the course flow on the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

instruction: What are the prerequisites for MTH 280(5) Calculus II?
response:
The prerequisite for **MTH 280(5) Calculus II** is **MTH 261(5) Calculus I**.

**Resources:**
See the course sequence on the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
You must successfully complete MTH 261 before you can register for MTH 280.

instruction: What course must be taken before MTH 345(3) Statistics?
response:
The prerequisite shown on the flowchart for **MTH 345(3) Statistics** is **MTH 280(5) Calculus II**.

**Details:**
• This prerequisite also applies to the alternative course, MTH 540(3) Statistical Theory.

**Resources:**
See the course flow on the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

instruction: What are the prerequisites for CSC 333(3) Lang. & Machines?
response:
The prerequisite for **CSC 333(3) Lang. & Machines** is **CSC 232(4) Data Structures**.

**Resources:**
This is shown on the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu
